entry.title: AT&T Signal Problem Fixed by Changing LTE to Data Only
entry.content:
I had an interview today. And the signal is pretty bad with my phone. I can hear the interviewer very clearly. But he can hardly hear me.
So I am thinking about whether it’s because I moved from IL to CA. I called AT&T about my problems.
They tried 2 ways, the second solution fixed my problem.
The first solution is to turn off my account in the tower and restart it. All I need to do is turning off my phone and turning it on.
I tested the call quality with a friends who lives within a mile. It doesn’t work.

The second solution is cutting the call with the agent. If you have a iPhone, go to setting - cellular - change to “Data Only”.
This method really solved my problem. Hope this can be helpful to other people.

There is another article talking about the same problem. Is your iPhone 6 or 6 Plus dropping calls on AT&T? Here’s the fix!
entry.summary: I had an interview today. And the signal is pretty bad with my phone. I can hear the interviewer very clearly. But he can hardly hear me.

entry.title: Resume
entry.content:
YANGHUI RONG

Palo Alto, CA 94306
yanghuirong2014@u.northwestern.edu
Visit my GitHub

EDUCATION

Northwestern University, Evanston, IL Dec. 2015
M.S. Computer Science GPA: 3.86/4.0
➢ Courses: Data Structures, Database Systems, Computer Systems, Algorithms, Machine Learning, Game Design, and Software Management.

Dalian Nationalities University, Dalian, China Jun. 2014
B.S. Electrical Engineering GPA: 88/100 Rank: No.1 in Department

SKILLS

Java, HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, Python, C, C#, Matlab, MySQL, SQL, Parse, Bootstrap, Angular.js, LINUX, .NET, Visual Studio, Photoshop CS5, Robotics and Control Systems

WORK EXPERIENCE

ZTEsoft Internship, Changsha, China Jun. 2015 - Sep. 2015
➢ Built front-end of Yunnan Poverty Alleviation Office Management System using Java, JSP, JavaScript and Bootstrap.
➢ Built my own tech blog on github.io by Hexo and designed web pages using ReactJS.
➢ Built Web Spider with Java, Jsoup, HtmlUnit and Apache POI to analyze the web pages and collect the needed content from web pages.

PROJECTS

Mobile App 1: FareShare, Northwestern University Mar. 2015 - Jul. 2015
Software developer, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Angular, Parse, Agile
➢ Developed a mobile app for people to share a taxi according to their locations and time to help them save money.
➢ Built a friendly UI for users to login in, enter information on a taxi form, and search for a taxi to join using JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap and Supersonic UI components.
➢ Used Parse as back-end and the Google Map API to get the latitude and longitude of the location and filter matches.
➢ Used Agile management with teammates via GitHub and Trello.

Mobile App 2: Onycholytics, Northwestern University Mar. 2015 - Jul. 2015
Software developer, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Angular, Parse, Agile
➢ Worked on a disease-tracking app for patients to track the healing progress of infected nails.
➢ Allowed patients to take photos of nails, edit/view their photos and contact doctors in App.
➢ Edited the image by HTML5 canvas for standardizing the outline of fingers.
➢ Used Agile management via GitHub and Trello and implemented Karma-Jasmine unit test and end-to-end test.

Sentiment Analysis on Naive Bayes, Northwestern University Jan. 2015 - Mar. 2015
Software developer, Python, Naive Bayes, NLTK
➢ Trained the system with more than 10k reviews from http://www.rateitall.com by Naive Bayes and saved statistical result dictionaries (like hashtables) to pickle files and output if the input review is positive or negative.
➢ Evaluation: 10-fold Cross Validation (Naive Bayes: Precision: 87%, Improved Classifier: Precision: 89%, Average Precision of other groups: 80%)

Database Application Implementing Academic System, Northwestern University Nov. 2015
➢ Worked on a program that allowed students to login, check the transcript, enroll in courses according to enrollment and pre-requisites, etc.
➢ Used an API to connect to MySQL Database and stored procedures.

HONOR

2nd Place among over 100 teams in National RoboCup & the Chinese Robotics Championship Aug. 2012

entry.title: configTomcatAtEclipse
entry.content:
唔，今天又配置环境了0 0.好不容易想蹭个页面的小功能做一做，所以需要重新配置一下环境。用intellij配置的话，我不知道那种VM argument写在哪里。因为要连数据库嘛。
以前用Eclipse配置过一次了，所以这次还是Eclipse配置环境吧。大概花了一小时吧。写一下需要做的步骤和遇到的问题。
问题1，在eclipse里面没找到新建web project
在eclipse的右上角有一个Java EE | Java 切换到Java EE就好了。
（我反复打开了很多次- - 好坑 我就说我下的就是Eclipse EE嘛。）
问题2，在我的Tomcat/webapps里面打死也没找到我部署的项目。
首先，需要在跟console位置差不多的地方找到server，新建一个server，把项目导入进去，然后双击新建好的server，选择第二个Use Tomcat Installation
Server Path 就是安装 Tomcat的路径
Deploy Path 我是选的 webapps
问题3，tomcat端口被占用
参考昨天的那个ps -ef|grep指令来弄吧~
问题4，run configuration里面的配置直接复制过来是有问题的
仔细检查一下，不需要反斜杠

config里面的config.xml里面的目标数据库改一下。

VS2010 - VS2010 SP1
dll -> c/windows
MYSQL upgrade
entry.summary:

以前用Eclipse配置过一次了，所以这次还是Eclipse配置环境吧。大概花了一小时吧

entry.title: Tomcat
entry.content:
8.5
(题外话：今天好烦躁，出差了，换了一个环境，之前用intellij搭建的超级简单的项目居然出问题了，localhost:8080访问不了之类的，同时127.0.0.1:8080又可以访问)
（后来后来，通过程序猿鼓励师的帮忙，首先解决了tomcat 不能 shutdown的问题，后来又解决了找不到java class的问题，后来又有别的问题。解决方案如下）
出现的错误 tomcat,intellij
问题1，端口被占用，不能使用./shutdown.sh关闭Tomcat
localhost没有和那个127.0.0.1联系一起 去/etc/hosts 里面绑定一下（之前的mysites和127.0.0.1绑定了，已经被我删掉了）
问题2，端口被占用
ps -ef|grep tomcat 看看被占用的端口是什么 比如1066
然后 kill -9 1066
问题3，web.xml找不到Test的问题
就是对src目录进行mark dictionary as source root
问题4，output path有问题
应该要改为 /Users/yanghuirong/Documents/web_workspace/test/web/WEB-INF/classes
（把鼠标放在test的根目录 然后按花❀键和回车 设置path）
entry.summary:
8.5
(题外话：今天好烦躁，出差了，换了一个环境，之前用intellij搭建的超级简单的项目居然出问题了，localhost:8080访问不了之类的，同时127.0.0.1:8080又可以访问)
